sentences.english: And we had the cheek to call the Taliban vandals.
sentences.chinese: 而我們還曾厚顏無恥地稱塔利班爲野蠻人。

sentences.english: Khiva's name became synonymous with cruelty and barbarity in contemporary Britain when, in 1842, two army officers, Colonel Charles Stoddart and Captain Arthur Conolly, were beheaded here in public.
sentences.chinese: 在當代英國，希瓦這個名字是殘暴和野蠻的同義詞。

sentences.english: Early one morning, Shmi was attacked and abducted by the savage Tusken Raiders.
sentences.chinese: 一天清晨，野蠻的塔斯肯襲擊者毆打併綁架了施密。

sentences.english: 52 [Comment From miber]—anything new/interesting for the barbarian or witch doctor?
sentences.chinese: 巫醫或者是野蠻人有沒有什麼新鮮事？

sentences.english: Schools will help to civilize the wild tribes there.
sentences.chinese: 學校將有助於使那兒的野蠻部落文明化。

sentences.english: You call Chinggis khan as a barbarian, what a joke.
sentences.chinese: 你們說成吉思汗是個野蠻人，這是個笑話。

sentences.english: The football had to be paused because of the barbaric supporters.
sentences.chinese: 殷爲那些野蠻的助威者，劂球比賽郴得不暫停。

sentences.english: Hadrian's Wall is built across Britannia to keep out the barbarians .
sentences.chinese: 橫貫大不列顛的哈德連長城被修築用來防禦野蠻人。

sentences.english: The damage was caused by rough handling when the goods were loaded on board ship at the dock.
sentences.chinese: 貨物損壞是在碼頭搬運裝船時因野蠻裝卸所造成的。

sentences.english: Cannibals captured him and took them to their village.
sentences.chinese: 那裏食人肉的野蠻人抓住了他，把他帶到住處。

sentences.english: Islam does not permit this sort of barbaric crime.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯蘭教不允許這樣的野蠻罪行。
野蠻人把西部一座座城鎮洗劫一空。

sentences.english: The completely untravelled person will view all foreigners as the savage regards a member of another herd.
sentences.chinese: 那些完全沒外出旅行過的人會視所有外族爲野蠻人。

sentences.english: The accident was caused by rough handling at the port.
sentences.chinese: 事故是由於在港口野蠻裝卸造成的。

sentences.english: From fanaticism to barbarism is only one step.
sentences.chinese: 從狂熱到野蠻，僅一步之遙。

sentences.english: that had led to barbarism of Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 導致了納粹德國的野蠻暴行。

definition: to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
